title: Phone Addiction Forces Aussie Kids Into Detox Camps | 10 News+
description: “I just can’t stop.”  No tech, no sugar, no mirrors and no contact with the outside world - for nine days, smartphone addicted Aussie teens undergo a basic army-like training program designed to get them back to reality, and the change is incredible.  For the full story here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WCP4HnVSQ2s  Watch and stream free on 10 and YouTube. Catch up on Spotify. title: NSW Triple Murder Sparks Internal Police Probe As Hunt For Suspect Julian Ingram Continues | 10 News
description: Police have launched a critical incident investigation following a triple murder at Lake Cargelligo in the NSW Central West.  Authorities are continuing to search for suspect Julian Ingram, with his last reported sighting over a week ago near Mount Hope. title: Dan Andrews’ Medical Episode, Japan Ski Lift Victim Named, Trump Pushes Cuba Deal | 10’s Late News
description: Tonight on 10’s Late News – The Liberal and National parties have held another crisis meeting in the hopes of repairing the Coalition's rift, former Victorian Premier Daniel Andrews is reportedly recovering from a serious medical episode, a Sunshine Coast woman has been identified as the Australian who died in an accident at a ski resort in Japan, Victorian detectives have revealed they strongly believe accused police killer Dezi Freeman is dead and that his remains may be found in Mount Buffalo National Park, the hunt continues for suspected triple murderer Julian Ingram, and Cuba is suffering from acute fuel shortages as Donald Trump ramps up pressure on its government to make a deal. title: Fire Erupts During ISIS Terror Attack on Niger Airport | 10 News
description: Islamic State militants have conducted an attack on an international airport in West Africa, according to footage released by the Terrorist organisation, renewing concerns about the security situation in Niger.  The militants blew up a plane in an aircraft hangar, as well as set off near an unmanned aerial vehicle (UAV) and a helicopter.  The footage was distributed by SITE Intelligence Group, which tracks jihadist activity worldwide. The US has ordered non-emergency government employees and their family members to leave the West African country because of safety risks. title: Groundhog Predicts Six More Weeks Of Winter | 10 News
description: Emerging from his burrow on Groundhog's Day (February 2), Punxsutawney Phil made his highly anticipated annual prediction, forecasting six more weeks of winter in the United States.  Legend has it that if the groundhog "sees its shadow" on February 2, a further six weeks of winter is to come, while no shadow indicates an early spring is coming.  Thousands gathered at Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania, for the nation's most renowned Groundhog's Day celebration, which occurs on a hill known as Gobbler's Knob. According to the Pennsylvania Groundhog Club, they organised their first trek to the location 139 years ago.
